00045 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;
00046 
00047 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00048                                                unsigned long uld,
00049                                                unsigned long *r)
00050 {
00051     /*
00052      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00053      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00054      * 3.x.
00055      */
00056 
00057     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00058     unsigned long tq, rh;
00059     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00060 
00061     p.ull = ull;
00062     q.ull = 0;
00063     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00064 
00065     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00066         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00067         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00068         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00069         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00070     }
00071 
00072     if (r)
00073         *r = p.ull;
00074 
00075     return q.ull;
00076 }
00077 
00078 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00079 
00080     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00081     
00082     int dummy;
00083 
00084     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00085         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00086         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00087         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00088         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00089 
00090     return i;
00091 }
00092 
00093 static inline long long rthal_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00094 
00095     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00096 
00097     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00098         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00099         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00100         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00101         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00102         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00103         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00104         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00105         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00106         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00107         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00108         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00109         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00110         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00111         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00112         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00113         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00114         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00115         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00116         "1:\t\n" \
00117         : "=A" (ll) \
00118         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00119         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00120 
00121     return ll;
00122 }

00124 /*
00125  *  u64div32c.c is a helper function provided, 2003-03-03, by:
00126  *  Copyright (C) 2003 Nils Hagge <hagge@rts.uni-hannover.de>
00127  */
00128 
00129 static inline unsigned long long rthal_u64div32c(unsigned long long a,
00130                                                  unsigned long b,
00131                                                  int *r) {
00132     __asm__ __volatile(
00133        "\n        movl    %%eax,%%ebx"
00134        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%eax"
00135        "\n        xorl    %%edx,%%edx"
00136        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00137        "\n        xchgl   %%eax,%%ebx"
00138        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00139        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%ecx"
00140        "\n        movl    %%ebx,%%edx"
00141        : "=a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "=d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1])
00142        : "a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1]), "c" (b)
00143        : "%ebx"
00144        );
00145 
00146     return a;
00147 }
00148 
00149 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00150     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00151     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00152             : "=r" (word)
00153             : "r"  (word));
00154     return word;
00155 }

00203     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));

00213 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00214 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00215 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00216 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))
00217 #define rthal_local_irq_flags(x)        ((x) = !!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00218 #define rthal_local_irq_test()          (!!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00219 #define rthal_local_irq_sync(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00220

00222 #define rthal_hw_unlock(flags)          adeos_hw_local_irq_restore(flags)
00223 #define rthal_hw_enable()               adeos_hw_sti()
00224 #define rthal_hw_disable()              adeos_hw_cli()

00227 #define rthal_linux_cli()                adeos_stall_pipeline_from(adp_root)
00228 #define rthal_linux_local_irq_save(x)    ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(adp_root))
00229 #define rthal_linux_local_irq_restore(x) adeos_restore_pipeline_from(adp_root,x)
00230 #define rthal_linux_local_irq_restore_nosync(x,cpuid) adeos_restore_pipeline_nosync(adp_root,x,cpuid)

00235 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00236 
00237     rthal_cli();
00238     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00239 }
00240 
00241 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00242 
00243     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00244     rthal_sti();
00245 }
00246 
00247 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00248 
00249     unsigned long flags;
00250     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00251     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00252     return flags;
00253 }
00254 
00255 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00256                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00257     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00258     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);
00259 }

00261 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00262 #define rthal_cpu_relax(x) \
00263 do { \
00264    int i = 0; \
00265    do \
00266      cpu_relax(); \
00267    while (++i < x); \
00268 } while(0)
00269 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00271 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00272 
00273 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00274    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00275    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00276    instead. */
00277 
00278 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00279     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL)))->task;
00280 }
00281 
00282 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00283 
00284 {
00285     int *esp;
00286 
00287     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00288 
00289     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00290         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00291 
00292     return get_current();
00293 }
00294 
00295 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00296 
00297 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00298     return current;
00299 }
00300 
00301 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00302     return current;
00303 }
00304 
00305 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00306 
00307 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00308 
00309     if (delay) {
00310         unsigned long flags;
00311         rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00312 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00313         apic_read(APIC_LVTT);
00314         apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00315         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00316         apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00317 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00318         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00319         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00320 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00321         rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00322     }
00323 }
